com.magnet.android.mms.controller

Class ControllerFactory<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magnet.android.mms.controller.ControllerFactory<T>

  • public abstract class ControllerFactory<T>
extends Object
    Use this class to obtain instances of controller classes for making method calls to a specific Magnet backend.

    • Method Detail

      • initSchemaMaps

        protected void initSchemaMaps()

      • setCompatiblityVersion

        public boolean setCompatiblityVersion(int version)
        Internal Use Only: Set the compatibility version for using the controller against a previous version of the cloud server.
        Parameters:
        version - The back-end version to which the controller is targeted.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if the SDK doesn't support the version.

      • getCompatiblityVersion

        public int getCompatiblityVersion()
        Retrieve the current compatibility version.
        Returns:
        The current compatibility version, or -1 if the compatibility version is not set (works only with the latest version).

      • getSchema

        public com.magnet.android.mms.controller.RequestSchema getSchema()
        Internal Use Only

      • obtainInstance

        public T obtainInstance(String connName)
                 throws SchemaException
        Construct a new proxy controller instance for making controller method calls in asynchronous mode.
        Parameters:
        connName - Name of the connection defining the endpoint.
        Returns:
        A new proxy instance of the Controller class implementing the controller interface. See getControllerClass() for more information.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if the Controller class fails to load. Possible reasons include missing dependent classes in the classpath.

      • obtainSyncInstance

        public T obtainSyncInstance(ConnectionConfigManager.ConnectionConfig conn)
                     throws SchemaException
        Internal Use Only: Construct a new proxy controller instance for making controller method calls in synchronous mode.
        Parameters:
        conn - Connection defining the endpoint.
        Returns:
        A new proxy instance of the Controller class implementing the controller interface. See getControllerClass() for more information.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if the Controller class fails to load. Possible reasons include missing dependent classes in the classpath.

      • getControllerClass

        public Class<T> getControllerClass()
        Retrieve the controller Java interface associated with this factory instance.
        Returns:
        The controller Java interface associated with this factory instance.
